results.title: The Young volunteers
results.creator_credit: Peter Whale and Overseas Film & Television Centre
results.brief_description: British Voluntary Service Overseas: shows orientation process for volunteers at a South London Teachers College. Includes scenes of volunteers in Mauritus, Lima (Peru), Korea, Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, Tanzania.

results.title: The Wynns, winegrowers
results.brief_description: Traces the growth of the Wynn’s family wind business over 50 years. From small beginnings they now own large vineyards in various parts of Australia. Illustrates the organisation of the entire industry from growing the grapes to marketing bottled table wines, champagne and flagons.

results.title: The World of semi conductors
results.creator_credit: Michael Oitom and A E I
results.brief_description: Describes the electrical properties of semiconductor materials, the effects of adding various controlled impurities, and the way in which semiconductors can be used for rectification or as amplifiers. Examples of both applications are shown, ranging from the minute transistorised transmitter in a radio pill for medical research to the banks of semiconductor rectifiers on heavy duty electric railway locomotives. Sketches the manufacturing process involved and examines the possibility of using semiconductors for power generation, central heating and refrigeration.

results.title: The Wizard of speed and time
results.creator_credit: Deven Chierighino, Mike Jittlov and Mike Jittlou Productions
results.brief_description: An examination of pixillation technique. From a mountain cave blasts a green wizard, skimming along the highway at incredible speed until slipping on a banana peel. Then from beneath the wreckage of a shattered movie studio, he magically resurrects every piece of equipment and celebrates with song and sparkles.

results.title: The Winged go-betweens
results.creator_credit: Miu Chin and Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio
results.brief_description: A nature film on the life of bees, concentrating in particular on their most useful function - the pollination of flowers. Using close-ups the camera reveals the work and behaviour of these insects in a way rarely seen before on the screen. A fascinating insight into their world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Miu Chin and Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio

results.title: The Windwheel
results.brief_description: The windwheel is a short animated story of a girl and her father at a fun park. It was drawn entirely under the camera by Susan Stamp using charcoal as the primary drawing medium. The story follows the father and his daughter as they share the sights, sounds and rides of the fun park. When she is given a small windwheel, the girl is delighted and plays happily until her father is accidentally knocked in the eye by it.

results.title: The Willmar 8 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lee Grant, Julie Thompson, Mary Beth Yarrow and GTV Productions
results.brief_description: An award winning documentary which tells the story of how unequal pay, denial of promotional opportunity and lack of respect drove 8 women to form a union and begin the first bank strike in Minnesota. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Grant, Julie Thompson, Mary Beth Yarrow and GTV Productions

results.title: The Wilderness world of Sigurd F. Olson
results.creator_credit: Ray J. Christensen, Steve A Kahlenbeck and Filmedia
results.brief_description: An exploration of the creative response to nature of America’s foremost interpretive naturalist, Sigurd F. Olson. He talks about the challenges and joys of writing, and the wilderness areas of Canada and the northern United States, with film of the dramatic changing seasons of this area.

results.title: The White rose [NTSC]
results.brief_description: The first of a trilogy by Verhoeven (followed by The Nasty girl (1990) and Mother’s courage (1996)), that examines the moral implications of individual events and actions that occurred during the Third Reich, and offers a critical analysis of their impact on the present. Based on on a true story of student resistance to Nazi rule, “The White rose” is set in Verhoeven’s native Bavaria, a predominantly Catholic region. During the Nazi era, a group of German students and their professor formed a secret society dedicated to protesting the regime. Known collectively as the ‘White Rose’, the Munich-based group distributed anti-Hitler literature that exposed Nazi persecutions. Their resistance to the Nazis inspired a student uprising at the University of Munich in 1943, and led to a massive Gestapo search for the ‘Bolshevist instigators.’ Eventually they were caught, tried and killed. After the film’s release, the German government initially refused to allow it to be shown abroad due to an epilogue which pointedly observed that the legal judgment condemning the White Rose society had never been rescinded. Ultimately, the political controversy surrounding Verhoeven’s film directly caused the German government to officially invalidate the Nazi ‘People’s Court’ system that sentenced the group to death. Cast includes Lena Stolze, Martin Benrath, Wulf Kessler and Oliver Siebert. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: The Wheelwright
results.creator_credit: David Cons, G. Buckland-Smith and Worshipful Company of Wheelwright
results.brief_description: Film of one of the few remaining wheelwrights in Britain making a wheel. This is contrasted with the making of wheels for modern motor cars.
